Interface Normalizable

All Known Implementing Classes:
ComplexD, ComplexF, RealD, RealF
public interface Normalizable
This interface implements the part of the concept of a Division Field from mathematics. Specifically, if is the portion that says the field supports the notion of 'length' or 'magnitude' when several of them are used as scaling factors in vector spaces.

For real numbers this is just the idea of distance from a number line origin. In a vector space where several are involved, one uses a root-mean-square method to combine them. Think Pythagorus.

For complex numbers, it is the radius in a polar representation. When several are involved, it is Pythagorus again, but the squares are formed with numbers and their conjugates, but computation is made easier by ignoring the imaginary and just squaring the components.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Dr Alfred W Differ

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Number
    modulus()
    This is the square root of the SQ Modulus.
    Number
    sqModulus()
    This function delivers the sum of the squares of the numeric values.

  • Method Details

    • modulus

      Number modulus()
      This is the square root of the SQ Modulus. It is smarter to calculate SQModulus first.
      Returns:
      Number

    • sqModulus

      Number sqModulus()
      This function delivers the sum of the squares of the numeric values. Many times it is the modulus squared that is actually needed so it makes sense to calculate this before the modulus itself.
      Returns:
      Number
